Reviews.Title: “good for the price”
Reviews.Author: Silvercouple
Reviews.Content: we got this place for £25 a night and were very happy with it. OK the corridors had a little smell of damp but they were clean, the room we got was very clean and had everything we needed. It is only a 5 min walk to Gants hill underground (which is on the central line) 15 mins to Stratford and within 40 mins and we were in central London (its actually in zone 4). As with all Travelodges no food (except a warmed sandwich or a packed breakfast) but the harvester is next door and there are other eateries in the nearby area. But we were out early into London and usually not back until late. The staff were very freindly and helpful especially the lady on reception with the long dark hair. We heard no undue noise from the pub or surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: Gareth306
Reviews.Content: Items stolen from car park, CCTV out of operation. Rooms in desperate need of modernising.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - better than sleeping in the street (but only because it was snowing)”
Reviews.Author: Martin M
Reviews.Content: I want this to sound like a balanced review but i also want to be honest. So here are the facts. 1. This hotel shares its 10 space car park with a busy Harvester restaurant 2. We were only able to get 2 pillows between the 3 people in our party 3. To hotel clearly has not been decorated in a long time 4. There is no noise control and dispite shouting and screaming throughout both nights of our two night stay nothing was done about it.# 5. There is no breakfast facilities, but you can order a microwaved sandwich (we did not) In my opinion Would not touch this place again with a barge pole. A dive an not suitable to carry the travel-lodge branding. the facilities a poor and it is not very clean. It is full with noisy drunken people and there is no one to police it. Despite us paying for 3 people to stay there they could not supply even basic amenities like enough pillows, tea, coffee, mugs or towels. Good points The hotel staff tried their best but they clearly dont have the tools to work with. Oh and if you like the smell of Febreze you will love this place and the whole hotel smells like its been douched in the stuff. Conclusion absolute dive, only stay here if it is your absolute last resort.

Reviews.Title: “Buyer beware - Would rather stay in pig sty”
Reviews.Author: Bob_S292929
Reviews.Content: We travelled 120 miles with our 4 year old daughter, only to find the whole hotel stank. The floor of our room was covered in crumbs and the bath had a large revolting plug of human hair (assumption: it was human). The carpet was wet and sticky ...yuk!. We had to leave,..in the end we couldn't find anywhere to stay locally so had to drive 120 miles back home again. Our daughter behaved like a real trooper in the back of the car the whole way. A sad and miserable experience. Will never touch travelodge anywhere ever again - too much dissapointment and lost money...

Reviews.Title: “Badly needs refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: Kenarf
Reviews.Content: On the plus side the staff are friendly and helpful and the rooms are cheap. On the minus side the hotel needs a complete refurbishment - walls need repainting, carpet should be taken out and shot. If Travelodge ever wish to rival Premier Inn they have got to raise their game.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best, but adequate for the price.”
Reviews.Author: DonRutherford
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with friends for 1 night whilst going to a concert at the O2 so just wanted somewhere to sleep and it fulfilled that function perfectly well. Definitely needs some investment as is starting to look tatty, but for Â£19 in London, need I say more.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty, smelly, the worst!!”
Reviews.Author: snaphappy45
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 1 night thankfully. Room was dirty and smelly, leg broken off bed, no pillows. Bathroom filthy, shower did not work. When complained was told that they may not have pillows as they were quite full ?? Was moved to another room that was in much the same state, carpets stained, walls bashed & dirty. This time the leg on this bed was just about hanging on. I know travelodge are a budget chain, no frills but I expect basic standards of cleanliness and beds that can be slept in! I have only ever used travelodge 3 times and found poor service at all 3 but never filthy conditions like this.

Reviews.Title: “Worst travelodge in London”
Reviews.Author: ratrace_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel falls well below the basic standards set by travelodge, which to be honest are slipping anyway, and smells of either bad management at the hotel or just flogging an assest until it completely breaks down. The hotel is in need of a complete overhall and is starting to resemble the london doss houses that you specifically choose travelodge to avoid. Where do you start? There is a pervading odour of cigarette smoke in the corridors The rooms smell damp Fixtures and fittings in the bathrooms are rusty The tiles in the bathroom are old and cracked and look like they were a left over job lot used to decorate British rail toilets in the 80's - what a horrible design - stick to plain white! The place is generally dirty and poorly cleaned I was pretty surprised when I lay on the bed to start rocking backwards and so decided to look underneath only to find on one side a leg missing completely, replaced by a large pile of towels to prop the bed up and on the other side the leg was hanging off and offering no support. As it was midnight, I was dog tired and had unpacked I decided to use the dust bin as a support to get a stable night sleep instead of complaining and getting moved to another room. This hotel is a disgrace. The only redeeming features are it is colose to the tube network, there is a pub next door and the man in the chinese take away across the road is extremely friendly and gives you a plate and cutlery if he knowes you are staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic”
Reviews.Author: MagicFamily
Reviews.Content: A trip to London on business is always tricky when it comes to working out whether to drive and park in the centre or park on the outside and catch the Tube. I decided on the latter, and whilst it was only 5 minutes walk from Gants Hill Underground station, the accommodation was very basic. The room needed modernising, you wouldn't have a bath unless you were desparate and the TV had no remote. There was a pub/restaurant next door which was very affordable but overall, this is as basic a room as you can get. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the Plague !”
Reviews.Author: Professor_Popkiss
Reviews.Content: This review refers to the Gants Hill Travelodge, rather than the centrally placed one in Ilford. We arrived at 4pm, being greeted by a less than informative and a somewhat un-enthusiastic receptionist, located at a reception desk in what could best be described as a dilapidated, tired and run down building in a less than salubrious part of London suburbia. No information was provided about the attached (Harvester) restaurant regarding meal and breakfast times and availability. The allocated ground floor room was the normal Travelodge layout with a double bed, sofa bed, TV, tea making facilities and en-suite bathroom. This room had clearly seen better days as it was definitely in need of some severe renovation â€“ or preferably, demolition. First, the bathroom; this featured a bath with chipped and worn enamel, detached bath plug and a wide range of black mould in residence around the tiles. It appeared that the toilet bowl had escaped the attention of bleach, disinfectant and a toilet brush for quite a while. The bedroom area was in a similar â€˜goodâ€™ condition. Of the six castors on the bed, the majority were broken. The pillows, although encased in pillowcases, featured a wide range of staining throughout. To continue the ambience, the curtains appeared to have been there since the place was built and again appeared not to have been washed since then. The kettle interior featured an unusual calcite feature as its centre piece and also sported a variety of black speckles to complement the calcite. To complete the tea making facilities, two unmatched cups of different sizes sat nearby, again with a poor standard of cleanliness. The socket for the telephone, was also hanging off the wall. Didnâ€™t get round to trying the TV. The carpet didnâ€™t look like it had seen a Hoover for years, especially around the edges and under the malformed bed lay a nice supply of antique dust. Indeed, bodily parts from a previous resident, in the form of toe nail clippings, were still visible on the floor. The carpet also featured various stains of unknown origin. The wall also had a worrying brown stain on it as well which was not due to damp â€“ I didnâ€™t investigate further. Now donâ€™t get me wrong, I appreciate that these are â€˜budgetâ€™ rooms so I donâ€™t expect all mod cons and facilities. I have used Travelodge many times before and am aware that consumables such as soap etc are not provided so I have no issues with that, however I do expect an acceptable level of hygiene and cleanliness especially from such a large chain, regardless of the cost. In all honesty, I have never experienced a Travelodge room as bad as this before. I have photos of all these delights but have chosen not to post them so as not to contravene the 'family friendly' requirement !! Faced with these horrors, at 4:30pm we left, having secured a room in a nearby Premier Travelinn (a competitor in the budget hotel market). On leaving, as we left we raised our complaint and disgust with the receptionist. As she made no effort to have our concerns addressed by either offering another room or having things cleaned and fixed, I would suspect ourâ€™s was not the first complaint â€“ nor is it likely to be the last. She promised me that the manager would phone me to discuss our complaint (he didnâ€™t) as she couldnâ€™t find a complaint form and we were not prepared to wait around any longer while she did. In summary â€“ avoid like The Plague â€¦ or catch it (The Plague that is !) at Gants Hill Travelodge !! POSTSCRIPT: Travelodge have responded to my complaint, apologising for the poor standard/cleanliness and advised that Gants Hill is due for refurbishment towards the end of 2008. They also acknowledged that cleanliness however is unrelated to refurbishment and will be refunding the cost of my booking.

Reviews.Title: “simplicty”
Reviews.Author: adilbhai
Reviews.Content: i was visitng some family, a ncie place, i did go for a walk about and found the area to be quite peceful, the room was very clean and there was a cinema close by which made the trip more exciting. i became a regular at this food palce chicken cottage round the corner, near the mcd's it had a ncie feeling. overall nice place ilford is kool

Reviews.Title: “simple and good choice”
Reviews.Author: Rune_Norge
Reviews.Content: Travelodge in Ilford is a simple good choice with good connections to central London. It lies in zone 4 with very good train connections, 15 minutes to Liverpool street station. 5 min walk to station. Travlodge paking garage in same building as the hotel if you come by car. We booked a familiy room for bargain 29Â£, spacy with double bed + sofa/pullout,bath/wc, tv (5 channels only, bbc, bbc2 and five ok, 2 others blurred) and breakfast. A bit noisy, try to get a room in front, road with heavy traffic behind. Breakfast was a package with cereals , milk, juice, apricots, muffin aso. Avoid if you want 'real' breakfast! Cinema, bowling and restaurants nearby, very good chinese buffet rest. centre of Ilford 2 mins away has a good choice of shops/centres with prices far below central London. Everything in the room worked, always warm water, clean enough but floor carpet and one duvet inside the cover was not clean at all. The neighbourhood is known to be a bit rough, we saw a few gangs with pitbull dogs but did not feel uncomfortable. Ilford is in east London and has a mixed population, a lot from Asia.

HotelInfo.Name: Travelodge - London Ilford Gants Hill
HotelInfo.Address: Beehive Lane, Gants Hill | Ilford, Essex, London IG4 5DR, England
